# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = Dates.yearmonth.(df[:dt]) .|> ym -> Int(ym)
end
```

This function adds a new column `ym` to the DataFrame `df` by transforming the `dt` column. It uses the `Dates.yearmonth` function to extract the year and month from the date-time value, then converts this value to an `Int`. The `.|>` operator is used to pipe the result of the transformation into the `Int` constructor.
